definition[0]: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time
example[0]: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
definition[1]: to become healthy and strong again, or to make someone or something healthy and strong again
example[1]: The economy is beginning to revive.
example[2]: an attempt to revive the steel industry
example[3]: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
definition[2]: to produce a play again after it has not been performed for a long time
example[4]: A London theatre has decided to revive the 1950s musical ‘In Town’.
definition[3]: if a company, the economy etc revives, or if something revives it, it becomes stronger or more active
example[5]: Some regions, such as the Northeast, will revive much more slowly than the national economy.
example[6]: To revive sales, the company has cut prices by as much as 9%.
definition[4]: to bring something back into existence or popularity again
example[7]: The project is to be revived.
